MEMO: Progress Report on Utilization Kit Project
TO: NAEB Utilization Committee Members
FROM: Clair R* Tettemer
BATE: March 10, I960
Now that most of you have given me your comments about the Utilization Kit Project, I
want to try to summarize your thoughts and suggestions • If in this process I misinterpret
or in some other way do violence to your ideas, I apologize and will try to correct
the impression in the next report#
Several other organizations are also interested in this problem of developing better
utilization of educational broadcasts# Let me comment on their activities first:
1# AACTK (American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education)
Early in February the Subcommittee on Television of the AACTE held a session
in Chicago# Their purpose was to develop an outline to be employed in the
training of teachers in the effective use of instructional television# Law
Rhodes and Wanda Mitchell attended this Chicago meeting and subsequently I
talked with Philip Lewis from the Chicago Schools and Paul Allen, the Associate
Secretaries for Research and Studies of the AACTE about their project# They
see their outline being used as a basis for organizing workshops and courses
to achieve effective use of instructional television# From our list of suggested
kit projects this seems to be somewhat in line with our suggestion number 10*
They are aiming their workshops and courses towards two groups of teachers:
a) Teachers who are likely to be planning and presenting lessons on television,
b) Classroom teachers who will be utilizing these lessons in their classroom#
Lew reports that at the Chicago meeting the group formally suggested that filmed
materials be created to supplement their course# These would include: a) actual
television lessons as presented and b) filmed examples of good classroom viewing
techniques in various situations* These also seemed to be consistent with our
plans# From my conversations with the representatives from the AACTE I gathered
that they have no intention of producing these materials but would very much
like to keep in contact with us to see how the NAEB materials could be coordinated
with their outline# At the present time this outline is in the process of being
completed and we will get a copy of this as soon as it becomes available#
Since two of our committee members, Lew Rhodes and Wanda Mitchell, are working
with this Television Subcommittee, coordination should not be too difficult#
2* PAVI Television Committee
The Television Committee of the Department of Audio Visual Instruction is planning
to write and publish a booklet dealing with utilization of educational broad¬
casts • They are proposing to hold an invitational seminar sometime in the late
summer or early fall# The purpose of this seminar would be to provide the
orientation, outline and material for this booklet# A Steering Committee within
the DAVI has been set up to plan and organize the seminar# This is under the
direction of their Television Committee chairman, Raymond Wyman, Professor of
Education at the University of Massachusetts# They are tentatively planning
a meeting of this Steering Committee during the IERT session in Columbus in
May# I met with this committee during the DAVI convention in Cincinnati and
explained our project and objectives • They were very interested and felt that
there was a definite need for these utilization kits# They asked that we work
together to see that their booklet and our kits are coordinated#
